oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effect of failed transfer of passive immunity on disease risk in pre-weaned calves: a systematic review and meta-analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thompson, Alexis C.
Smith, David R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: failure of passive transfer
disease risk
calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Calves that fail to absorb maternal antibodies, termed failed transfer of passive immunity (FTPI), are more susceptible to infectious disease, but estimates of the strength of association between FTPI and disease risk vary widely.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 260
